conclusion: Determine the longest propagation time of refracted light in the hemisphere.
Triangle ABC is equilateral with side length L; Point D is on side AB such that BD = L/4.
Incident angle at point D is calculated using triangle geometry.
Light refracts at point D into the hemisphere.
Apply Snell's Law: n sin(θ_r) = sin(θ_i).
Path length x inside the hemisphere is x = L / cos(30° - θ_r).
Time taken for light to travel is t = x / v, where v = c / n.
Maximize time by minimizing θ_r for longest path inside hemisphere.
The longest propagation time of refracted light is approximately 1.62L / c.
